page.title: 19A Famous Naturalist
page.content: Mr. John Barrett, OBE, is a famous naturalist who lives in Dale. He learned about nature first as a boy at school and then during his time in the RAF. When he was a POW in Germany, he continued to study birds. After the war he became Warden of Dale Fort Field Centre, wrote books and made broadcasts. As members of the public came repeatedly to consult him, he inaugurated a series of walks and talks on the local flora, fauna, geology and history. He has been called the "Pied Piper of Dale". He believes that nature will find its own balance provided that man does not upset things by pollution and killing. We, the children of Dale School who have worked on this survey, agree with him.
